S.TRANSL: Long ago in a village were a husband and wife, Petsoksi and Dilindo.
They had three children, two were girls, Gromme and Lasme.
Of them all, Gromme was the elder, and Lasme the younger.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ mɛ ʦɵtʦɵ-hɛm-bi jo-ŋa khɵtle-kʌ ʔu-ʦhɛri khakʦalʌp
S.TRANSL: And of the children, the youngest was Khaktsalop.

S.FORM: dilindo pɛʦoksi grômmɛ lasmɛ mʌnʌ khakʦalʌp ʔʌmhɛm-po ʔūn-pʌriwar bhʌ̄ŋpɛ gō:-tɛ ʦɛnʉte mō:-tnu bʌ̄ŋte mō:-tnu bʰʌ̄ŋte mō:-tnu
S.TRANSL: Dilindo, Pechoksi, Gromme, Lasme and Khaktsalop had a beautiful family.

S.FORM: mʌlʌ mɛ ʦɵtʦɵ-hɛm mʌ-bhoɔ̄r-ŋa mō:-tnu-lo ʔūn-pɛp ʣhɛ̄m khɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: But those children were not growing well, and their father died.
Then they suffered.

S.FORM: mɛbē:na jā:tha ʔūn-mɛ̂m jo ʣhɛ̄m khɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Then later their mother also died.

S.FORM: grômmɛ lasmɛ khakʦalʌp ʦɵtʦɵ mō:-tnu-lo reskʌp ʦhʉk-tɛnu
S.TRANSL: Gromme, Lasme and Khaktsalop were children and became orphans.
They suffered greatly.

S.FORM: kok-sa mʌ-kok-sa kʌ̄m-bî-m kɛm mʉ-nɛ mʌt-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Able to or not, they had to do the housework.
They had to do the housework.

S.FORM: tunɵ̂l didi bahini grômmɛ lasmɛ-su-ʔɛ mɵ̂l mʉ-ssu
S.TRANSL: One day, Gromme and Lasme had a discussion.

S.FORM: ʣʌkhʌl loɔ̄m-bi khoɔ̂n-nɛ-po la:gi mʌnʌ ʣʌkhʌl-bi khɵs-ti thū:nɛm-bʉjʉ
S.TRANSL: They went down into the forest in order to go search for nettle fiber.
Khaktsalop followed them.

S.FORM: ʔunɵ̂l ʣʌkhʌl kâ:-nɛ-na ʔusominɛ kʌ̄m ʔoɔ̂n-nɛ mʌiç-pɛ
S.TRANSL: They had to peel the nettle fiber during the day and return home that evening.
They peeled the nettle fiber quickly.

S.FORM: mɛbelo khakʦalʌp ʔus-dhā: mɛbi gʌripʌri tɛçka mɛçka ʦēm-si-tô-ŋ mō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: At that time, Khaktsalop was playing beneath his sisters, here and there.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ ʔɛʣɛ khakʦalʌp ghrʉ̂m-tɛ-na khjou ʔip-dɵk-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Later Khaktsalop grew tired and fell asleep.

S.FORM: grômmɛ-kolo lasmɛ-su-ʔɛ dhawa mɛ ʣʌkhʌl kâ:k-tɛsu-lo mɛ lekʦêm-ʔɛ nek-to nek-to khɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Gromme and Lasme quickly peeled the nettle fiber and covered [him] with the inside of the fiber.

S.FORM: ʔusominɛ kʌ̄m ʔoɔ̂n bela-bi ʔus-wɛ lɵ̂m-tɛsu khakʦalʌp khɛbi khɵs-tɛ hola khɛbi jo mu-thɵ-wɛsu
S.TRANSL: That evening, when they returned home, they searched for their brother, where had Khaktsalop gone, they could not find him anywhere.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ mɛ lekʦêm-thēm mɛjo wɵŋ-iti phlêm-tɛsu
S.TRANSL: They went to the place [where they had put] the nettle core and stepped on it.
At that time, they heard something snap.

S.FORM: hɛ̂pi mɛ lekʦêm phoɔl-to phoɔl-to khɵs-ti-lo mɛ go-jʉ ʔus-wɛ ni mɛ go-jʉ go
S.TRANSL: As they dug through the nettle core, their brother was down in there.
He was hungry and thirsty and had fallen asleep.
Later he became stiff with cold.
They looked, woke him up and lifted him.
Their brother did not move, did not speak.
They thought he was dead.
They covered him with nettle core and left him down there.
They returned home alone.
They came home and did things.
They became young women.

S.FORM: mʌna hʌp-de khoɔ̂i-de bʌja khoɔ̂n-nɛ mɵ̂l-mʉ-ssu
S.TRANSL: They decided to go to the place they were fated to go to.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ sʉ̂: lɛ̂l khɵts-i sʉ̂: lɛ̂l bher-i sʌ̄ŋ-lʉ̂-iti
S.TRANSL: Who should go first, who should fly first, they asked each other.

S.FORM: kʌ̄m-bi mu-nɛ ʔus-seī-kî-m mʌ̄m-kî-m sʉ̂ jo mʌ-mō:n-wɛ
S.TRANSL: There was noone at home to look after them, to remember them.

S.FORM: mɛkaʔɛ-ŋa ʔus-kʌ̄m-bi kʌ̄m-bikʌ khoɔ̂n-nɛ khoɔ̂n-nɛ nû: ʦhʉk-tɛ
S.TRANSL: They decided to leave their house.
They discussed who would fly away first.

S.FORM: melo grôm-ʔɛ sîŋ-tɛ mokho lasmɛ-ŋa lɛ̂l bhēr-e lasmɛ-ʔɛ pheri ʔu-wɛ̂: lʉ̂: tɛ mʌʔʌ wɛ̂:-ŋa lɛ̂l bhēr-e
S.TRANSL: Gromme said: "so, Lasme should fly first" and Lasme said to her sister "No, sister should fly first".
And they pushed each other like that.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ jā:tha lasmɛ-ʔɛ mokho ʔuŋa lɛ̂l bhēr-ŋʌ
S.TRANSL: And later Lasme said "So, I will fly first".

S.FORM: ʔɛs-tɛ-na lasmɛ bhēr-tɛ wʌja-ta wʌja-ta khɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: And after saying that, Lasme flew and went towards the lowlands.
That they had pushed each other earlier became a burden.
This conflict piled up.
Gromme, the elder, was unable to fly.
Gromme had to stay in Uthalo.

S.FORM: jā:tha ʔu-wɛ-ʔɛ ʔu-wɛ̂: grômmɛ dʌ̄m-bi hō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Later the younger sibling came to meet her older sister Gromme.
At that time, the older sister was at home.
She was there, at Uthal.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ lasmɛ ni ʔu-tâ:p-po kʌ̄m noɔm-bi ʔɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Then Lasme has to return to keep her own house.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ khɵles-tɛ mɛbelo grômmɛ kʌ̄m-bi mō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: She arrived and at that time, Gromme was at home.

S.FORM: mɛbi mō:-tɛ-lo ʔuthʌl-bi mō:-tɛ-lo jaka:-bʉjʉ thū:nɛm-bʉjʉ tû sʌ̄ŋ-bi poɔpoɔp garigari ʣē:-ʣō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: While she was there at Uthal, far away down in the forest, there was an owl in a tree continuously crying.

S.FORM: pʌp poɔpoɔp ʔɛs-tɛ sege sege dā:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: It said "pwop, pwopwop" and bothered her with the sound.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ grômmɛ-ʔɛ ʔɛs-tɛ tikîm poɔpoɔp ni sʉ̂:-ʔɛ go ʔi-sêi-sa-ŋʌnu ni
S.TRANSL: Gromme said: Who is going to kill that noisy owl for me?
When I'm exhausted like this, I would eat it.
The owl made noise like before.
Gromme said what she had before.
The owl was rude.
"Sister, don't be too rude"
"I will eat you all up" said the owl.
And Gromme said again:
"Who will eat him for me?
When he exhausts me like this, I would eat him.

S.FORM: ʔusominɛ ʦhʉk-tɛ ʣʌkhʌl kʉ̂r-tɛsu-na kʌ̄m ʔɵs-ti
S.TRANSL: In the evening, they carried the nettle fiber and returned home.

S.FORM: kʌ̄m noɔ̄m mʉ-ssu kʌ̄m-bi mʉ-iti ʣʌkhʌl thʉ̂:-tɛsu sʉ-tɛsu sɵlɛ thʉ̂:-tɛsu
S.TRANSL: They did the housework, and were at home, and they spun the nettle fiber and cleaned it and spun it into thread.

S.FORM: siki mʉ-ssu bhaŋra pʉ-ssu bʌ̄ŋpɛ pʉ-ssu
S.TRANSL: They did their handicrafts, wove vests, wove beautifully.
They braided the flower decorations, and the flowers parts.

S.FORM: phurka mʉ-ssu blāŋ-sî-iti ʔathā: bʌ̄ŋpɛ ʦhʉk-iti
S.TRANSL: They made decorations, dressed themselves up, and became very beautiful.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ tunɵ̂l mɵ̂l mʉ-ssu ʔis-hʌp-de khoɔ̂i-de bʌja loɔ̄m-bi khɵʦ-i sēi-bi khɵʦ-i
S.TRANSL: Then one day they decided to go to search for the place they were fated to be.

S.FORM: didi bahini-ʔɛ mɵ̂l mʉ-ssu sʉ̂: lɛ̂l khoɔ̂n-nɛ
S.TRANSL: The sisters discussed who would go first.
They did not agree.
Gromme told her sister Lasme:

S.FORM: lasmɛ lɛ̂l bhēr-e lasmɛ lɛ̂l khɵʦ-e
S.TRANSL: "Lasme, you fly first, you go first"
Lasme told her sister:
"No, my sister, you go first.
You fly first."

S.FORM: mʌnʌ ʔʌmsu toɔ̄ltoɔ̄l lʉ̂:-iti jā:tha lasmɛ-ʔɛ ʔɛs-tɛ mokho ʔûŋ-ŋa lɛ̂l khoɔi-ŋʌ
S.TRANSL: They argued back and forth, and later Lasme said "if that's the case, then I will go first."

S.FORM: mʌnʌ lasmɛ phʉrʉ bhēr-tɛ khɵs-tɛ ʔu-kʌ̄m-bikʌ ʔʌm ʣhē:s khɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: And Lasme flew, she went from her house and flew upwards.

S.FORM: ʔu-hʌp-de bʌja sēi-bi ʦɛri bʌja sēi-bi khɵs-tɛ
S.TRANSL: She went to search for her fated place, to search for land.

S.FORM: ʔu-wɛ khɵs-tɛ tʌrʌ ʔu-wɛ̂:-ʔɛ ʔʌʣō: toɔ̄ltoɔ̄l lʉ̂:-iti-m ʦhʌl puk-tʌ-tɛ grôm-bi
S.TRANSL: The younger sister left, but the conflict from their earlier arguing piled up on Gromme.
Gromme could not fly.
Gromme stayed in her house, she stayed in Uthal.

S.FORM: ʔu-kʌ̄m-bi mō:-tɛ-lo jaka:-bʉjʉ tû: sʌ̄ŋ-bʉjʉ poɔpoɔp mō:-tɛ ʔe
S.TRANSL: When she was in her house, there was an owl in a tree far away and down below.
That owl made noise.
He kept saying: "pwopwopwop"

S.FORM: mʌnʌ grômmɛ sege sege lō:-tɛ-na sege sege dak-pɛ mɛ poɔpoɔp ʔajejejeje sʉ̂:-ʔɛ go ʔi-sêi-sa-ŋʌnu ni tikîm poɔpoɔp ni
S.TRANSL: Gromme felt crazy with the noise, and said: "who will kill that noisy owl for me?
When he exhausts me like this, I would eat him."
And the owl heard this.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ poɔpoɔp ʣē:-ʣō:-tɛ-ŋa grômmɛ-ʔɛ mêŋ ʔɛs-ʣō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: And the owl continued to cry, and Gromme continued to say the same thing.
And one day the owl was rude.

S.FORM: ʔe rē:mɛ tō:mɛ koɔ̄m mu-ghɵ̂l wɵ
S.TRANSL: "Hey sister, don't be rude.
I will eat you all up."
And the owl continued to speak like that.
Gromme continued to say the same thing.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ tunɵ̂l poɔpoɔp-ʔɛ grômmɛ sesēi sêl-kʉ-tɛ
S.TRANSL: And one day, the owl ate Gromme all up.
One day, her younger sister Lasme arrived.
When she arrived, her older sister was not at home.

S.FORM: tɛtha mɛtha khɵle-de sên-tɛ ʔu-wɛ̂: mu-thɵ-wɛ
S.TRANSL: She looked here, there and everywhere and could not find her sister.

S.FORM: jaka:-bʉjʉ poɔpoɔp tʌ̂ŋ ŋoɔ̄ŋoɔ̄ ŋɛī-de-pɛ mō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Far away down below, a lone owl was sitting, showing signs of stress.
She asked him.

S.FORM: ʔe rē: hou tɛbi ʔʌ-wɛ̂: ʔi-thɵ-tɛ hou
S.TRANSL: "Hey, have you seen my sister here?
Have you seen Gromme around here?" she asked.

S.FORM: poɔpoɔp-ʔɛ mā: jo mu-lʉ̂:t-wɛ lɛbɛ lɛbɛ mō:-ʣō:-tɛ
S.TRANSL: "I saw nothing at all" said the owl, and he continued to be silent.

S.FORM: suk khep sʌmmʌ lasmɛ-ʔɛ poɔpoɔp sîŋ-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Lasme asked the owl three times.
The owl had to tell.
And the owl said: "she was rude.
I ate her up."
And Lasme said:

S.FORM: khɵle ni mʌ-kʉ-khā:t-wɛ hola ʔu-soloŋolo khɛbi gɵ
S.TRANSL: "You probably didn't eat her completely. Where are her bones?"
The owl said:
"I put them in a hole up in a tree."

S.FORM: lasmɛ-ʔɛ mɛ ʔu-soloŋolo ʔu-phɛ̄r-bi hoɔi-mʉ-tɛ poɔpoɔp
S.TRANSL: Lasme made the owl bring to bones to her.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ poɔpoɔp-ʔɛ ʔu-soloŋolo hɵ̂:-tɛ lasmɛ phɛ̄r-bi
S.TRANSL: And the owl brought the bones to Lasme.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ lasmɛ-ʔɛ rakʦiki-po gɵbi ʦʉ̂ŋ-tɛ-na lɵlɵ lʌt-tɛ soɔ̄mdu lʌt-tɛ
S.TRANSL: Lasme wrapped [the bones] in cloth made of nettle fiber and performed an enchantment, a eulogy.
And she woke up her sister.
Her sister woke up.
Gromme said:

S.FORM: ʔʌmmʌmʌmʌm mâŋ sɛt-ʔɛ ʔûŋ ni ʔip-dɵ-kʌ-ta-m
S.TRANSL: "Oh my, how deeply I slept."
Then Lasme said:
"Sister, noone put you to sleep.

S.FORM: jakâ:-m rē: poɔpoɔp-ʔɛ sesēi ʔi-sêl-ko-tɛ̂-m go
S.TRANSL: That owl from over there ate you all up."

S.FORM: mʌnʌ mɛ nɵ̂l-kʌ didi bahini tuju mʉ̂-iti
S.TRANSL: From that day, the sister were together.

S.FORM: tô: mʉ-ssu siki mʉ-ssu rēŋ pê:k-tɛsu dhʌʣura mʉ-ssu phurka mʉ-ssu
S.TRANSL: They wove, made handicrafts, made decorations.
They stayed together nicely.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ mɛ didi bahini-po ʔus-sîl grômsîl ʔɛ̂n-ʣɵ jo-ŋa mɛ̂m ʦʉnʉ-hɛm-ʔɛ bêŋmɛ ʦɵ-hɛm-ʔɛ was ʦhoɔ̄m-nu-lo ʔathā: bʌ̄ŋpɛ ʦhoɔ̄m-nu
S.TRANSL: Those sisters' dance, [called] Gromsil, even now when mothers and women and sisters and children dance the dance, they dance it beautifully.

S.FORM: ʔathā: bʌ̄ŋpɛ sîl khɵtle-ʔɛ jɛç-ki-m sîl grômsîl ʔɛ̂n-ʣɵ jo-ŋa khɵtle-ʔɛ jɛç-ki-m sîl gɵ
S.TRANSL: Even now, the beautiful dance that everyone like is Gromsil, it's a dance that everyone likes.

S.FORM: mʌnʌ jʉnɛm-bi ʣhē:slʌka brokpɛ ʣe-to je
S.TRANSL: In the summer, the "brokpɛ" insect comes down from the highlands, calling.
The lowland insect, calling out, comes up from the lowlands.

S.FORM: ʣhē:s-lʌkʌ brokpɛ je-lo raʦaʦaʦaʦa ʔɛç-sa je ʔu-dhʌlu
S.TRANSL: When the highland insect comes down from the highlands, he comes downwards saying "rachachacha".

S.FORM: mʌnʌ wʌja-lʌkʌ noɔ̄mdulêm ʣe-to khōŋ-lo njejejejeje ʔɛç-sa khōŋ
S.TRANSL: When the lowland insect goes up from the lowlands, calling, he goes up saying "nyeyeyeyeye".

S.FORM: mʌnʌ tɛ brokpɛ-kolo noɔ̄mdulêm-kolo tuju dʉm-i
S.TRANSL: These highland and lowland insects meet together.
They meet in the middle.

S.FORM: mɛ brokpɛ-kolo noɔ̄mdulêm-kolo ʔʌnʌ̄m grômmɛ lasmɛ-su-po sʌrup lʉ-ssu ʔê-m
S.TRANSL: The highland and lowland insects acted like the nature of Gromme and Lasme.

S.FORM: ʔʌ̄msu dʉm-î-m pʌʦhi mɛbena tʌ̂ŋ ʔik-bʌja-bi thō:ʦi hɵ nū:ri hɵ
S.TRANSL: Only after they meet does autumn come to our area.
At that time, the earth really changes colors.
The crops must turn yellow.

S.FORM: sʌrōŋbʌ̄ŋ thē: seī-ki-lo bʌ̄ŋpɛ bʌja ʔathā: bʌ̄ŋpɛ ʣhē:s ʔoɔ̄m ʣɛ ʔoɔ̄m
S.TRANSL: When we look at this, the earth is very beautiful, the lowlands are yellow, the crops are yellow.
When we think of that, when we look at that, we really feel like this [like the story of Gromme and Lasme is real].
